name: Centre on Regulation in Europe
goal: The Centre on Regulation in Europe (CERRE) is an independent think tank working in the field of network and digital industriesâ€™ regulation. Established in 2010, it seeks to promote robust and consistent regulation systems and practices in Europe's network and digital industries. In brief, CERRE aims to contribute to European and global economic policy-making through open, fact-based and policy-relevant research, analysis and debate. CERRE's membership includes 1) national and regional regulatory authorities, 2) operators, infrastructure managers and system managers in the energy, digital (telecommunications & media), post, water and mobility sectors, and 3) universities and research centres specialised in regulation. CERRE's activities are guided by scientific excellence and full academic independence, as well as by strategic and political relevance.
interests: Audiovisual and Media, Climate Action, Communication, Competition, Consumer Affairs, Energy, Information Society, Internal Market, Research and Technology, Trans-European Networks, Transport
euInitiatives: Data Protection - Digital Agenda - Electronic Communications Code - Energy Union - ETS Review - EU Climate and Energy Package 2030 - GDPR - #NoPlace4Hate - REFIT of AVMS Directive - Fourth Railway Package
